subject: RE: [junit] byte can be bigger than 127 ...
msgSnippet: ... Sorry, missed the - before 128. But I had a java language specification problem a while ago, using FastJavac compilation in Forte CE 2.0, so the compiler
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jeff Nielsen
> > > . Class Byte: Success means that -128 > 127

Sorry, missed the '-' before 128.

But I had a java language specification problem a while ago, using FastJavac
compilation in Forte CE 2.0, so the compiler might be a problem too.
Maybe internally something changed, you can verify:

C:\XXX>%JAVA_HOME%javap -classpath .;c:/junit/junit3.7/j
unit.jar StrangeByteTest

You then get some output like this:

Compiled from StrangeByteTest.java
public class StrangeByteTest extends junit.framework.TestCase {
byte minByte;
byte classByte;
public StrangeByteTest(java.lang.String);
public void testByteMaxValue();
public static void main(java.lang.String[]);
}

verify if one of those bytes are not magicaly changed to int or long ?
